method.name: emulation_bgp_srte_policies_config
method.description: This procedure configures BGP IPv4 and IPv6 SRTE Policies

description.text: This option defines the action to be taken on the BGP server.

choice.choiceText: Create the BGP SRTE Policies configuration
Enable the BGP SRTE Policies configuration, requires the use of -handle.
Modify the BGP SRTE Policies configuration, requires the use of -handle.

description.text: bgpSRTEPoliciesListV4: -handle is returned by procedure emulation_bgp_srte_policies_config when a IPv4 SRTE Policy is created or modified bgpSRTEPoliciesListV6: -handle is returned by procedure emulation_bgp_srte_policies_config when a IPv6 SRTE Policy is created or modified
Number of SRTE Policies

Select the Active check box to activate the SRTE Policies. This means that the SRTE Policies can be started or stopped and is usable in the state machine. If this check box is not selected, the element is not able to respond to any action including Start and Stop.
Set Policy Type for BGP SRTE Policies
Distinguisher for SRTE Policies
Policy Color for SRTE Policies
IPv4 End Point for SRTE Policies
IPv6 End Point for SRTE Policies
Number of Tunnel TLVs for SRTE Policies
Enable Next Hop for SRTE Policies
Set IP Address of Next Hop for SRTE Policies

choice.choiceText: IP Address of the next hop will be selected manually
IP Address of the next hop will be same as local IP

description.text: Set Next Hop IP Type for SRTE Policies
IPv4 Next Hop IP Address for SRTE Policies
IPv6 Next Hop IP Address for SRTE Policies
Enable Origin for SRTE Policies
Origin for SRTE Policies

choice.choiceText: Origin for SRTE Policies is IGP
Origin for SRTE Policies is EGP
Origin for SRTE Policies is Incomplete

description.text: Enable Local Preference for SRTE Policies
Local Preference for SRTE Policies
Enable Multi Exit Discriminator for SRTE Policies
Multi Exit Discriminator for SRTE Policies
Enable Atomic Aggregate for SRTE Policies
Enable Aggregator ID for SRTE Policies
Aggregator ID for SRTE Policies
Sets the AS asssociated with the Aggregator router id for SRTE Policies
Enable Originator ID for SRTE Policies
Originator ID for the router that originated the rule for SRTE Policies
Enable Add Path for SRTE Policies
Add Path ID for SRTE Policies
Enable Community for SRTE Policies
Number of Communities for SRTE Policies
SRTE Policies Community Types

restriction.value: no_export no_advertised noexport_subconfed manual llgr_stale no_llgr

description.text: SRTE Policies Communities AS Number
SRTE Policies Communities Last Two Octets
Enable Ext Community for SRTE Policies
Number of Extended Communities for SRTE Policies
SRTE Policies Extended Communities Type

choice.choiceText: Extended Community type - Administrator AS2 octet
Extended Community type - Administrator AS4 octet
Extended Community type - Administrator AS2 Octet Link Bandwidth

restriction.value: admin_as_two_octet admin_ip admin_as_four_octet opaque evpn admin_as_two_octet_link_bw

description.text: SRTE Policies Extended Communities SubType

choice.choiceText: Extended Community sub type - Route target
Extended Community sub type - Extended bandwidth

restriction.value: route_target origin extended_bandwidth color encapsulation mac_address

description.text: SRTE Policies Extended Communities AS2 Number
BGP SRTE Policies Extended Communities Target Assigned Number 4
SRTE Policies Extended Communites IP
SRTE Policies Extended Community AS 4 Number
SRTE Policies Extended Target Assigned Number 2
SRTE Policies Extended Communities Opaque Data (Hex)
SRTE Policies Extended Communities Color CO Bits
SRTE Policies Extended Communities Color Reserved Bits
SRTE Policies Extended Communities Color Value
SRTE Policies Extended Communities Link Bandwidth
Enable override Reer as set mode for SRTE Policies
Set mode for AS value for SRTE Policies

choice.choiceText: Prepend Local AS to first segment

restriction.value: include_as_seq include_as_seq_conf include_as_set include_as_set_conf no_include prepend_as

description.text: Enable AS Path Segments for IPv4 SRTE Policies
Number of AS Path Segments for IPv4 SRTE Policies
Enable AS Path Segment for BGP SRTE Policies
AS Path Segment Type for BGP SRTE Policies

choice.choiceText: AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SEQ
AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SEQ-Confederation
AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SET
AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SET-Confederation

description.text: Number of AS Path Segments for BGP SRTE Policies
Enable AS number for BGP SRTE Policies
AS Path Segments AS Number for BGP SRTE Policies
Enable cluster for SRTE Policies
Number of Clusters for SRTE Policies
BGP LS Cluster ID for SRTE Policies

Select the Active check box to activate the Tunnel TLV in SRTE Policies. This means that the Tunnel TLV in SRTE Policies can be started or stopped and is usable in the state machine. If this check box is not selected, the element is not able to respond to any action including Start and Stop.
Number of Segment Lists for SRTE Policies
Enable Remote Endpoint Sub-TLV
AS Number for Tunnel TLV
Address Family for Tunnel TLV
IPv4 Address for Tunnel TLV
IPv6 Address for Tunnel TLV
Enable Color Sub-TLV for Tunnel TLV
Color CO Bits for Tunnel TLV
Color Reserved Bits for Tunnel TLV
Color Value for Tunnel TLV
Enable Preference Sub-TLV for Tunnel TLV
Preference for Tunnel TLV
Enable Binding Sub-TLV for Tunnel TLV
Binding SID Type for Tunnel TLV
4 Octet SID for Tunnel TLV
BSID As MPLS Label for Tunnel TLV
IPv6 SID for Tunnel TLV

Select the Active check box to activate the Sgement Lists in SRTE Policies. This means that the Sgement Lists in SRTE Policies can be started or stopped and is usable in the state machine. If this check box is not selected, the element is not able to respond to any action including Start and Stop.
Enable Weight for Segment List
Weight for Segment Lists
Number of Segment per Segments Lists

Select the Active check box to activate the Sgements in SRTE Policies. This means that the Segments in SRTE Policies can be started or stopped and is usable in the state machine. If this check box is not selected, the element is not able to respond to any action including Start and Stop.
Segments Type for Segements

restriction.value: mplssid ipv6sid ipv4nodeaddress ipv6nodeaddress ipv4nodeaddressindex ipv4localandremoteaddress ipv6nodeaddressindex ipv6localandremoteaddress

description.text: Label for Segments
Traffic Class for Segments
Bottom Of Stack for Segment List
Time to live for Segments
IPv6 SID for Segments
IPv4 Node address for Segments
IPv6 Node address for Segments
Interface Index for Segments
IPv4 Local address for Segments
IPv4 Remote address for Segments
IPv6 Local address for Segments
IPv6 Remote address for Segments
Optional TLV Type for Segments
Optional Label for Segments
Optional Traffic Class for Segments
Optional Time to live for Segments
Optional IPv6 SID for Segments

returnValue.value: A list containing the bgpSRTEPoliciesListV6 protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
When status is $::FAILURE, contains more information
Item Handle of any bgpSRTEPoliciesListV4 or bgpSRTEPoliciesListV6 configured

notes.note: Coded versus functional specification. When a -handle is provided with a BGP/BGP+ protocol stack handle or a protocol session handle, the api will create IPv4/IPv6 SRTE Policies When a -handle is provided with a BGP SRTE Policies Handle, the api will modify the created IPv4/IPv6 SRTE Policies

examples.example: See files starting with BGP_ in the Samples subdirectory. Also see some of the L2VPN, L3VPN, MPLS, and MVPN sample files for further examples of the BGP usage. See the BGP example in Appendix A, "Example APIs," for one specific example usage.
